conclusion: To determine collision time, analyze motion of cars using velocity-time graph.
Graph shows velocities of Car A and Car B as functions of time; both start decelerating at t = 0.
Car A starts at 25 m/s, Car B starts at 15 m/s; both decelerate linearly.
Calculate deceleration for Car A: -0.833 m/s².
Calculate deceleration for Car B: -0.75 m/s².
Calculate velocity of Car A at t = 20 s: 8.34 m/s.
Calculate distance traveled by Car A in 20 seconds: 333.33 m.
Calculate velocity of Car B at t = 20 s: 0 m/s.
Calculate distance traveled by Car B in 20 seconds: 150 m.
Calculate relative distance between cars at t = 20 s: 183.33 m.
Since relative distance is positive at t = 20 s, cars have not collided.
Conclusion: Cars collide after 20 seconds of braking.
